intro: Ipomoea supersticiosa, commonly known as the ghostflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as swamps and woodlands. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Ipomoea supersticiosa is known for its ephemeral blooming period, often appearing only during brief periods of wet weather.
